subanswer.text: Each day from Monday to Friday, if John drinks one glass of water per meal thrice a day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner) plus an additional glass before going to sleep, he consumes 4 glasses daily. Across five days, he would consume 4 * 5 = 20 glasses. The answer is 20.

Therefore, across both weekend days, we add 2*2=4 glasses.

0.user_question: John likes to have a glass of water with breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Finally, he has one before he goes to bed as well.  John does this every weekday, but on the weekends he likes to relax and have a soda with dinner instead.  How many glasses of water does John drink in a week?

1.subquestion: How many glasses of water does John drink during weekdays (Monday-Friday)?

subanswer.text: Each day from Monday to Friday, if John drinks one glass of water per meal thrice a day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner) plus an additional glass before going to sleep, he consumes 4 glasses daily. Across five days, he would consume 4 * 5 = 20 glasses. The answer is 20.

2.subquestion: How many glasses of water do John drink over the weekend (Saturday & Sunday), considering his preference changes on these days?

subanswer.text: On both Saturday and Sunday, John usually follows the same routine like during weekdays except replacing water with sodas at night time. That means on Saturdays and Sundays excluding desserts or snacks if any which haven't mentioned here so we only consider meals times i.e., Breakfast(water) , Lunch(Water), Dinner(Soda). Hence it can be concluded since the habit doesn’t change according to question statement even though what he consumes differs. Therefore he still takes three cups per day; hence twice seven makes twelve cupfuls throughout the entirety of the whole nonworking period spanning twenty four hours through out Sat and Sun because all other factors remain constant irrespective of their changing nature just once daily replacement isn’t significant enough compare against no consumption otherwise stated..

0.user_question: John likes to have a glass of water with breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Finally, he has one before he goes to bed as well.  John does this every weekday, but on the weekends he likes to relax and have a soda with dinner instead.  How many glasses of water does John drink in a week?

1.subquestion: How many days per week do John follow the same routine of having water (breakfast, lunch, and dinner)?

subanswer.text: There are five workdays in a week where John follows the same routine of having water during meals. The answer is 5.

2.subquestion: How many times does John consume an extra beverage over these regular occurrences due to preference change on Saturday or Sunday evenings?

subanswer.text: During the weekend, specifically on Friday when dinners overlap between the usual pattern and the new habit, John consumes one additional bottle compared to normal habits; plus another standard serving replacing Saturday’s typical consumption since no mention about any variation occurs then either day.
